snippet: The resumption of negotiations could relieve rising pressure from Israel to use military force against Iran, or buy Tehran time to relocate its centrifuges.
abstract: Global powers dealing with Iran's disputed nuclear program announce that they will resume face-to-face negotiations for the first time in more than a year, accepting month-old offer from Iranian negotiators; resumption of negotiations could relieve rising pressure from Israel to use military force against Iran, but could also function as a feint that would allow Iran to relocate its centrifuges.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and JAMES KANTER
byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish reported from Berlin, and James Kanter from Brussels. Reporting was contributed by Alan Cowell from London, Brian Knowlton from Washington, and Steven Erlanger and Alison Smale from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The resumption of negotiations could relieve rising pressure from Israel to use military force against Iran, or buy Tehran time to relocate its centrifuges.

headline.seo: Global Powers Agree to Resume Nuclear Talks With Iran
headline.main: World Powers Agree to Resume Nuclear Talks With Iran
headline.print_headline: Global Powers Agree to Resume Nuclear Negotiations After an Iranian Offer
